context: In Arabidopsis many terpene synthases have a modification of the conserved RRx8W motif. This entire motif can also be dispensable in enzymes with (E)-β-ocimene synthase activity, such as the snapdragon Ama0a23 enzyme. Monoterpene synthases from snapdragon fall within the Tps-g subfamily, whose members lack the RRx8W domain. Comparison of the MtEBOS protein sequence with other functional plant monoterpene synthases indicates the highest degree of conservation with known (E)-β-ocimene synthases from two other legumes, L. japonicus and P. lunatus (Fig. 3 ). We confined the comparison to enzymatically characterized mono- and sesqui-terpene synthases from angiosperm species. The sesquiterpene synthases from different species, producing farnesene, caryophyllene, d-cadinene, and epi-aristolochene form a strong cluster based on sequence (Fig. 3). However, sequence similarity alone is obviously not sufficient to make strong predictions about precise terpene synthase activity.

llm_generation.summary: (3e)-3,7-dimethylocta-1,3,6-triene is mentioned in the context of monoterpene synthases, specifically in relation to the enzymatic activity of (E)-β-ocimene synthase. The discussion highlights the conservation of certain motifs in terpene synthases and compares the sequence of MtEBOS with other known monoterpene synthases. While (3e)-3,7-dimethylocta-1,3,6-triene is not directly linked to a specific monoterpene synthase activity, it is part of a broader analysis of terpene synthase functions and their evolutionary relationships.
